p: The altitudinal and latitudinal limits of I. ricinus seem to be constrained by cold temperature (Ostfeld and Brunner 2015), and a range expansion of ticks to higher altitudes and latitudes is projected. Under climate-change scenarios, warmer winter temperatures, longer growing seasons and earlier summers with elevated temperatures are projected to occur, which could also result in a shift in the distribution of deer host populations (Jaenson and Lindgren 2011).
